alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 3:23PM EDT until September 05 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Bristol County in southeastern Massachusetts... Bristol County in Rhode Island... Central Kent County in Rhode Island... Southern Providence County in Rhode Island... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from south Foster to Providence and Cranston. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding in Providence and Cranston. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, East Providence, Coventry, West Warwick, Johnston, Bristol, Somerset, Barrington, Swansea, Seekonk, Rehoboth, Warren, Scituate, West Greenwich and Foster. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
